meanings.definition: Not feeling or showing regret or remorse
meanings.sent1: The impenitent criminal showed no remorse for his actions.
meanings.sent2: She remained impenitent even after being confronted with the evidence.
meanings.sent3: The impenitent child refused to apologize even when caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: His impenitent attitude towards his mistakes only led to more trouble.
meanings.sent5: The impenitent student never learned from his errors, repeating them over and over.

meanings.sent1: Despite the consequences, he remained impenitent about his actions.
meanings.sent2: The impenitent attitude of the defendant angered the judge.
meanings.sent3: Her impenitent behavior towards her friends eventually cost her their trust.
meanings.sent4: The impenitent protester refused to back down, standing firm in his beliefs.
meanings.sent5: His impenitent nature made it difficult for others to forgive him for his mistakes.
